AttributeType.title: AttributeType
AttributeType.description: Available attribute types for column metadata.

AvailabilityState.title: AvailabilityState
AvailabilityState.description: The availability of materialized data for a node

Column.title: Column
Column.description:
A column.

Columns can be physical (associated with ``Table`` objects) or abstract (associated
with ``Node`` objects).

ColumnOutput.title: ColumnOutput
ColumnOutput.description: A simplified column schema, without ID or dimensions.

CreateCubeNode.title: CreateCubeNode
CreateCubeNode.description: A create object for cube nodes

CreateSourceNode.title: CreateSourceNode
CreateSourceNode.description: A create object for source nodes

CubeElementMetadata.title: CubeElementMetadata
CubeElementMetadata.description: Metadata for an element in a cube

MutableAttributeTypeFields.title: MutableAttributeTypeFields
MutableAttributeTypeFields.description: Fields on attribute types that users can set.

NodeMode.title: NodeMode
NodeMode.description:
Node mode.

A node can be in one of the following modes:

1. PUBLISHED - Must be valid and not cause any child nodes to be invalid
2. DRAFT - Can be invalid, have invalid parents, and include dangling references

NodeOutput.title: NodeOutput
NodeOutput.description: Output for a node that shows the current revision.

NodeRevisionOutput.title: NodeRevisionOutput
NodeRevisionOutput.description: Output for a node revision with information about columns and if it is a metric.

NodeStatus.title: NodeStatus
NodeStatus.description:
Node status.

A node can have one of the following statuses:

1. VALID - All references to other nodes and node columns are valid
2. INVALID - One or more parent nodes are incompatible or do not exist

NodeType.title: NodeType
NodeType.description:
Node type.

A node can have 4 types, currently:

1. SOURCE nodes are root nodes in the DAG, and point to tables or views in a DB.
2. TRANSFORM nodes are SQL transformations, reading from SOURCE/TRANSFORM nodes.
3. METRIC nodes are leaves in the DAG, and have a single aggregation query.
4. DIMENSION nodes are special SOURCE nodes that can be auto-joined with METRICS.
5. CUBE nodes contain a reference to a set of METRICS and a set of DIMENSIONS.

NodeValidation.title: NodeValidation
NodeValidation.description: A validation of a provided node definition

TranslatedSQL.title: TranslatedSQL
TranslatedSQL.description: Class for SQL generated from a given metric.

UniquenessScope.title: UniquenessScope
UniquenessScope.description: The scope at which this attribute needs to be unique.

UpdateNode.title: UpdateNode
UpdateNode.description: Update node object where all fields are optional

UpdateTag.title: UpdateTag
UpdateTag.description: Update tag model. Only works on mutable fields.

UpsertMaterializationConfig.title: UpsertMaterializationConfig
UpsertMaterializationConfig.description: An upsert object for materialization configs
